qas.question: Dominic's education helped him to overcome who?
What helps define the work of the Dominican Order?
In what city did Dominic establish a school?
Who did Dominic entrust to start his school?
What city did Dominic not study in?

plausible_answers.text: the knowledge he needed to overcome the Manicheans

qas.question: What did the city of Palencia not give Dominic?
What method was not used by the Dominicans in working to defend the Church against peril?
What did not help define the work of the Dominican Order?
What city did Dominic not establish a school?

context: Dominic's education at <a0_0><b5_0>Palencia<b5_0/><a0_0/> gave him <b6_0>the knowledge he needed to overcome <a1_0>the Manicheans<b6_0/><a1_0/>. With <a2_0><b8_0>charity<b8_0/><a2_0/>, the other concept that most defines the work and spirituality of the order, <b7_0>study<b7_0/> became the method most used by the Dominicans in working to defend the Church against the perils that hounded it, and also of enlarging its authority over larger areas of the known world. In Dominic's thinking, it was impossible for men to preach what they did not or could not understand. When the brethren left Prouille, then, to begin their apostolic work, Dominic sent <a4_0>Matthew of <b9_0>Paris<b9_0/><a4_0/> to establish a school near the University of <a3_0>Paris<a3_0/>. This was the first of many Dominican schools established by the brethren, some near large universities throughout Europe.
